data.name: description
data.value:
The TestPlatform is a platform of computerized neuropsychological tests for the evaluation of executive functions. The product has the proposal to offer solutions innovating technologically in a practical and dynamic way. Intended for researchers, students and ordinary users.
Technical Manager: anacog@pobox.com - Ana Garcia
Developers: hugohon - Hugo Honda Ferreira fabiolamfleury - Fabíola Malta Fleury gabrielalbino - Gabriel Batista Albino Silva; 2018; More information: https://github.com/lab-neuro-comp/Test-Platform

data.name: instructionBoxText
data.value:
The participant must be clearly and uniformly oriented to test execution accordingly to participant group and experiment team.

For classic Stroop Test basic instructions are:
'In this task you must speak the name of the color in which the words are painted.'
or
'In this task you should read the word displayed on the screen.'

data.name: audioConfigInstructions
data.value:
General
Option Description
List name Sets the name of the list that will be chosen in the program definition. It is recommended that the list name characterize the chosen set of elements and the step comprising, for example, "Victoria1". The order in which the elements are informed will be kept in the respective list.
Audio list creation
Option Description
Audios Selects the folder containing the audio files to be placed in the list by the "Open" button.
Delete Item Excludes from the list the selected audio file with the "Delete" button.
Move Item Repositions the selected audio file in the list with the "Up" and "Down" buttons.
Play audio Represents the selected audio file using the computer's active sound devices. The selected File Name is displayed in the list and Location

data.name: imageConfigInstructions
data.value:
General
Option Description
Name Sets the name of the list that will be chosen in the program definition. It is recommended that the list name characterize the chosen set of elements and the step comprising, for example, "Victoria1". The order in which the elements are informed will be kept in the respective list."
List options
Option Description
Images Selects the folder containing the images to be inserted in the list by the "Open" button.
Delete Item Excludes from the list the image file selected with the "Delete" button.
Move Item Moves the item on the list.

data.name: newAudioInstructions
data.value:
Auditions of Tests Display
Option Description
List This screen displays the audios recorded in the previously executed tests. The audios of the test execution will be recorded in a file named with the chosen program and the identification of the participant, if this combination has already occurred the new audios will be added to the same file.
Creating audio files in WAV format
Option Description
Audio Creation In this screen it is possible to record WAV format audio files to be used as files in audio lists. Recording starts when you click the Record button and is finished and can be saved by the Stop / Save button

data.name: showDataInstructions
data.value:
General
Option Description
Export as .cvs It exports the results to a file with values separated by comma, which can be opened by spreadsheet editors programs (ex: libre office).
Play audio Option to transmit the recorded audio during the test run, if the program used had this option.
Results
Option Description
Program Indicates the name of the program that was running at the time of the stimulus.
Participant Shows the user name
Date Indicates the that date the program was run
Starting time Indicates the exact moment the user started the test
Exposition(ms) Indicates how long the exposure has appeared (if user responds the total exposure time is equivalent to the reaction time)
Sequence Indicates the chronological order in which the stimulu appeared for the user
Stimulus type Indicates which type of stimulus was shown to the user
Subtitle Indicates the caption displayed to the user
Subtitle position Indicates in which position the caption was displayed
Stimulus Indicates the name of the stimulus that was displayed to the user
Stimulus color Indicates the color that the stimulus appeared to the user
Audio Information if there was audio capture during the stimulus

data.name: technicalInformation
data.value:
Technical Information

 

 

After installation, it is recommended to only use the shortcut that is created on the desktop, not tampering with the libraries and files that are used by the platform.

 

All program, list, and experiment setup created are stored in text format files, which should not be accessed directly, only via application. Besides these files, audio libraries and file manipulation (.zip) and localization specific files are used (in the case of this version, files for english).

 

This application was developed using the C # language in the Visual Studio IDE platform, compatible with Windows Vista operating system or superior.

 

Use the link TestPlatform (Releases) to download any possible updates, checking the versino available there and your current version in about page.

 

For installation, the executable file must be placed in an application-only folder where the operating folders will be organized after the first run of the test as described below:

 

- TestPlatform (user-created folder for application use only) - TestFiles (files generated by the application to run the test)

 

Files and folders inside TestFiles should not be accessed, running the risk of corrupting files and making them inaccessible to the program!

 

To upgrade, the new version installation file must be run in the same folder as the previous version had been installed.

data.name: viewHelp
data.value:
TestPlatform

What is your question? 

  • How the platform works
    • Lists
    • Programs
    • Experiments
    • Execution
    • Results
    • Import/export
  • StroopTest
  • ReactionTest
  • MatchingTest
  • Platform Updates
  • Recommendations
  • Want to get in touch?

How the platform works

 This platform is used for definition, execution and result analysis of neuropsychological tests in pre defined paradigms. It works with units called lists, programs and experiments.

Lists are defined stimuli used in testing, being image, colors, words or audios.

Programs are test protocols defined by researcher using the platform and it can be of the following kinds: StroopTest, ReactionTest or MatchingTest. Each one representing one different paradigm.

Experiments are program collections, so that they can be executed in sequencies.

Each platform page has it own help button (on the upper left section), so that specific information can be given. The left side bar in main page shows navigable parts of the system.

The flow below describes how a program can be created, executed and has its results obtained in the system:

 

Lists

Created lists will be used in programs. One must choose list type and create or edit it, giving a name and content. For audio lists files used must be of type ".wav", if you wish, you can record those files on tab "Audios" in lists. Image files can be diverse (.png, .jpeg, .bpm, and others). Color lists use hexadecimal naming.

Programs

The programs are test configurations and can be created in the following paradigms:  StroopTest  , ReactionTest , MatchingTest . Each program may or may not have lists (depending on how it was defined) and can be changed, deleted or retrieved at any time.

Execution (Run)

To run a program or experiment, you must fill in the data in the toolbar, selecting what will be executed, who will be the participant and what will be the mark.


The mark is a keyboard signal generated by the program at the instant a stimulus is shown, normally used when a program is running in the background in conjunction with the platform, as an example neurospectrum, to collect more accurate data.

After completing the entries, simply click on the run button that the test will occur and the results will be generated.

Results

The results are displayed on pages according to the type of test performed, in tables that can be exported to excel (.csv).

When an experiment is run, the tables of the experiment and the respective programs that have been run are generated.

 

Import/Export

If you need to use lists, programs, or experiments on more than one computer, you can export files and import them into the platform by accessing those features in the menu.

StroopTest

It proposes the presentation of elements in sequence with exposure times and scheduled intervals. According to the Stroop paradigm, the presented elements carry some semantic conflict, such as the classic words of colored colors ( blue ). StroopTest offers different categories of stimuli - word, image, audio - that can be combined individually or in pairs promoting the Stroop effect in several different versions.

ReactionTest

It proposes the presentation of elements on screen that must have an interpretation from a response issued by the participant through the keyboard or touch screen. According to the reaction time paradigm, this response must be given as fast as possible, so that the expected response arises from the moment the element is displayed on the screen, and there may be an early response (commission) or there is no response after the display. ReactionTest provides different categories of stimuli - geometric shapes, image, words - that allow the evaluation of reaction time in several different versions.

MatchingTest

The matching tests with (or without) Model with Delay,Delay matching or non-matching-to-sample - DMTS / DNMTS are tests widely used in visual memory recognition.

Platform Updates

If you want to check if your application is up-to-date, check the latest release in here: https://github.com/lab-neuro-comp/Test-Platform/releases/latest 

You must do the following: 

  1. Check the version number in the latest release
  2. Check the version number in your application
  3. Download the newest version
  4. Install it in the same folder of the previous one

Look for the version released: 

And check your program version to see what is your current:

 

Recommendations

For use of the program it is recommended to use Windows 7 operating system or higher. It is also suggested that when using audio recording, use a device that is compatible with your computer and has been previously tested.

Want to get in touch?

If you encounter any problems fill out this form: https://github.com/lab-neuro-comp/Test-Platform/issues/new reporting what has happened, or send an email to someone responsible for the project. We recommend contacting if you can not get a question or suggestions!

Name Assignment Contact (GitHub/Email)
Ana Garcia Technical Manager anacog/anacog@pobox.com
Fabíola Fleury Developer fabiolamfleury/fabiola.mfleury@gmail.com
Gabriel Albino Developer gabrielalbino/enggabrielalbino@gmail.com

data.name: wordColorConfigInstructions
data.value:
General
Option Description
Name Indicates the name of the list. The list name must contain only alphanumeric characters and must have no spaces.
List Options
Option Description
Word list When the word list box is checked, the created word list will be saved.
Color list When the word list box is checked, the created color list is saved. If both boxes have been checked, both lists are saved.
New Item Opens a screen to fill in a new word and its color. The default color is black.
Delete Item Exclude from the list the word and its corresponding color selected with the "Delete" button.
Move Item Repositions the selected color word in the list with the "Up" and "Down" buttons.

data.name: experimentConfigInstructions
data.value:
General
Option Description
Experiment name It should be made with the name of the experiment that will be created. The name must contain only alphanumeric characters and should not contain any space. This same name is used when choosing the experiment that is run on the results page and import / export
Exposition
Option Description
Random order Indicates whether the exposure of the programs will be made at random in relation to the order that the user added. If the option is selected the user can select a Training.
Time
Option Description
Interval(ms) Indicates the interval between one program and another during the experiment
Program
Option Description
Add Adds a program to the list of experiment programs.
Training In random order the training program will always be the first test to be performed.
Delete Removes the selected program program from the program list of the experiment.
Others
Option Description
Instructions Describes the guidelines for the participant on the test run. Each displayed line will be displayed on a screen for 4 seconds.

data.name: stroopConfigInstructions
data.value:
General
Options Description
Program name It should be filled in with the name of the program that will be created. The name must contain only alphanumeric characters and should not contain any space. This same name will be used when choosing the program to be executed on the results and import / export page
Exposition
Options Description
Stimulus type In this field you must choose one of the types of stimulus available, they are:
               
                      
  • Word: In this mode a list of words and a list of colors for the word must be chosen, and from this the program will display the colored words
    •                   
  • Image: In this type a list of images must be chosen and from there the program will expose the images contained in the list.
    •                   
  • Image and word: In this type should be chosen a list of images and one of words. The generated program will alternately display one item from each list at a time.
    •                   
  • Word with audio: This type should select a list of words and an audio list that will be played by the program in the display of colored words with audio exposure.
    •                   
  • Image with audio: In this type you should select a list of images and another list of audio that will be played by the program.
    •                
Number of attempts Sets the amount of user attempts. The number of attempts is equal to the number of stimulus that will be shown.
When the number of items in the lists is less than the number of attempts, the number of items in the lists will be used, repeating the items necessary to reach the number of attempts. Likewise, when the number of items in the lists is greater than the number of attempts, the number of items in the lists corresponding to the number of attempts will be used.
Random order Indicates whether the exposure of the stimulus will be made randomly in relation to the order of the list.
Word size Indicates the font size of the text for "Word", "Word with audio" or "Image and word". The default size is 160.
Word color Indicates the color of the word, for "Word and Image" or "Image and Word". The default color is black.
Expand Image Sets the image expansion to the limit proportional to the screen. You can not simultaneously play the caption.
Rotate Image Sets the image rotation at the angle and direction indicated in the list.
Lists
Options Description
Words Loads the list of words that will be displayed for the "Word" and "Word with Audio" types. Non-random display will follow the order of the words in the list.
Colors Loads the color list of words that will be displayed for the "Word" and "Word with Audio" types. Non-random exposure will follow the order of the colors in the list.
Images Loads the list of images that will be displayed for the types "Image", "Image with Audio" and "Image and Word". Non-random exposure will follow the order of images in the list.
Audios Loads the list of audios that will be played in the test for the "Audio Word" and "Audio Picture" types. Non-random exposure will follow the order of the audios in the list.
Time
Options Description
Exposition(ms) Sets the duration in milliseconds of the chosen stimulus exposure, word or image.
Interval(ms) Sets the time in milliseconds between attempts.
Variable Interval Time Indicates that the interval will have the duration varied randomly from 400ms to the interval time reported.
Delay Sets the time in milliseconds between paired stimuli for the word, image, or word and image types. If not informed, interval time will be used.
Subtitle
Options Description
Enable Indicates whether the image display will have caption. When activating, it must be selected list of words to be displayed as caption.
Color Indicates the color of the caption. The color black will be used, if not informed
Position Indicates the location that the legend will be placed in relation to the stimulus: ←, on the left (pictures); ↑, above (words and pictures); → on the right (pictures); ↓, below (words and pictures); ·, To the center (images); Random, change apposition, according to the type of stimulus
Fix point
Options Description
Type Indicates the shape of the fixing point: + or ·
Point Color Indicates the color of the fix point.
Others
Options Description
Capture Audio during Play Indicates that the user's responses will be recorded automatically during execution. An audio file will be generated in the data folder. Requires the NAudio.dll file to be in the same folder as the test. The default is selected.
Background color Sets the color screen behind the stimulus during the presentation. The default is gray screen.
Instructions Describes the guidelines for the participant on the test run. Each displayed line will be displayed on a screen for 4 seconds.

data.name: TRConfigInstructions
data.value:
>
General
Options Description
Program name It should be filled in with the name of the program that will be created. The name must contain only alphanumeric characters and should not contain any space. This same name will be used when choosing the program to be executed on the results and import / export page
Exposition
Options Description
Stimulus type In this field you must choose one of the types of stimulus available, they are:
               
                      
  • Shapes: In this mode, one or more geometric shapes in the "Shapes" field must be chosen, and these shapes will be rendered randomly during the exposure. In addition to the geometric form (s) a color / color list must be chosen which will define the color (s) of the geometric shape.                   
  • Word: In this mode a list of words and a list of colors or a single color for the word must be chosen, and from this the program will display the colored words                   
  • Image: In this type a list of images must be chosen and from there the program will expose the images contained in the list.                   
  • Image and word: In this type should be chosen a list of images and one of words. The generated program will alternately display one item from each list at a time.                   
  • Word with audio: This type should select a list of words and an audio list that will be played by the program in the display of colored words with audio exposure.                   
  • Image with audio: In this type you should select a list of images and another list of audio that will be played by the program. The exhibition                
Stimulus size The size of the stimulus has different functions depending on the stimulus to which it applies.
                      
  • Shapes: In this type of stimulus the size equals the shape size, in pixels, that will be rendered                   
  • Word: In this type of stimulus, the size equals the font size, in pixels, of the text to be rendered                   
  • Image: In this type of animation, the size is the size of the pixel side of the image to be rendered.                
Font size The font size, in points, that will be used in words.
Distance from the stimulus to the center of the screen It indicates, in pixels, the distance that the stimulus will be rendered taking as reference the center of the screen.
Number of possible positions It indicates the number of possible positions for the stimulus and they are:                
                      
  • 1: In this option all the stimuli will appear in the center of the screen.                   
  • 2: In this option the stimuli can appear on the right of the screen or on the left.                   
  • 4: In this option the stimuli can appear in the positions: below the center, above the center, to the right of the center or to the left of the center.                   
  • 8: In this option the stimuli can appear in the positions: below the center, above the center, to the right of the center, to the left of the center or to any of the diagonals.                
Number of attempts Sets the amount of user attempts. The number of attempts is equal to the number of stimuli that will be shown.
When the number of items in the lists is less than the number of attempts, the number of items in the lists will be used, repeating the items necessary to reach the number of attempts . Likewise, when the number of items in the lists is greater than the number of attempts, the number of items in the lists corresponding to the number of attempts will be used.
Random order Indicates whether the exposure of the stimuli will be made randomly in relation to the order of the list.
Use beep Indicates whether a beep will be played together with the rendering of the stimulus.
Random beep Indicates whether the beep will be random. If it is random, it will only play in some renderings, if it is not random, it will play in all the stimuli.
Beep duration (ms) Indicates by how many milliseconds the beep will play
Type of color of the stimulus Indicates whether the stylus should have a single color throughout the program (Single Color) or whether it will be several different colors. In the case of several different colors these colors must be within a color list.
Stimulus color Indicates the color of the stimulus.
Lists
Options Description
Words Loads the list of words that will be displayed for the types "Word", "Word and Image" and "Word with Audio". Non-random display will follow the order of the words in the list.
Colors Loads the color list of the words that will be displayed for the types "Shapes", "Word", "Word and Image" and "Word with Audio". Non-random exposure will follow the order of the colors in the list.
Images Loads the list of images that will be displayed for the types "Image", "Image with Audio" and "Word and Image". Non-random exposure will follow the order of the images in the list.
Audios Loads the list of audios that will be played in the test for the "Audio Word" and "Audio Picture" types. Non-random exposure will follow the order of the audios in the list.
Time
Options Description
Exposition(ms) Sets the duration in milliseconds of the chosen stimulus exposure, word or image.
Interval(ms) Sets the time in milliseconds between attempts.
Variable Interval Time Indicates that the interval will have the duration varied randomly from 400ms to the interval time reported.
Forms
Options Description
Forms Indicates which geometric shapes will be used in the program of type "shapes"
FixPoint
Options Description
Type Indicates the shape of the fixing point: + or ·
Fixpoint Color Indicates the color of the fixation point.
User answers
Options Description
User response Indicates which keys the user will press to respond to the stimulus.
Others
Options Description
Background color Sets the color screen behind the stimulus during the presentation. The default is white screen.
Instructions Describes the guidelines for the participant on the test run. Each displayed line will be displayed on a screen for 4 seconds.

data.name: experimentResultInstructions
data.value:
General
Option Description
Export as .cvs It exports the results to a file with values separated by comma, which can be opened by spreadsheet editors programs (ex: libre office).
Results
Option Description
experiment Indicates the name of the experiment that was run.
program Indicates the name of the program that was running at the time of the stimulus.
Participant Shows the user name
Date Indicates the that date the program was run
Starting time Indicates the exact moment the user started the experiment
test time Indicates the exact moment the user started the program
Sequence Indicates the chronological order in which the program appeared for the user

data.name: fileManagmentConfigInstructions
data.value:
General
Option Description
Existing files / Deleted files This list indicates the files that exist and can be deleted or the files that have been deleted and can be recovered
Files to be restored / deleted This list indicates which files exist and will be deleted or deleted files will be recovered
Red files The files indicated in red by the list indicate that they already have a program or experiment with the same name in the source folder and restoring / deleting this file will result in the loss of the file with the same name in the destination folder

data.name: TRResultsInstructions
data.value:
a
General
Option Description
Export as .cvs It exports the results to a file with values separated by comma, which can be opened by spreadsheet editors programs (ex: libre office).
Results
Option Description
program Indicates the name of the program that was running at the time of the stimulus.
Participant Shows the user name
Date Indicates the that date the program was run
Starting time Indicates the exact moment the user started the test
Exhibition time Indicates the exact moment when the exposure occurred
TR(ms) Indicates the reaction time of the user to the stimulus shown, which can be negative in case of anticipation of the response, zero if there was no reaction to the stimulus or positive if there was a reaction in time.
Interva(ms) Elapsed time between the stimulus shown and the next, and may be random or not according to the configuration of the program, except in case of anticipation of the response of the user to the stimulus or if there is no reaction to the stimulus(ms)
Estimated Interval(ms) Elapsed time between the stimulus shown and the next, which may be random or not according to the program configuration
Exposure time(ms) Moment in which the stimulus was shown having as reference the beginning of the execution of the program.
Exposition(ms) Indicates how long the exposure has appeared (if user responds the total exposure time is equivalent to the reaction time)
Sequence Indicates the chronological order in which the stimulu appeared for the user
Position Indicates in which position the stimulus was rendered
User answer Indicates which key was pressed by the user to respond to the stimulus
Stimulus type Indicates which type of stimulus was shown to the user
Stimulus Indicates the name of the stimulus that was displayed to the user
Stimulus color Indicates the color that the stimulus appeared to the user
Beep Indicates whether or not the beep was rendered when rendering the stimulus

data.name: deleteList
data.value: Are you sure that you want to delete all the selected lists?

data.name: exportInstructions
data.value:
General
Option Description
Existing files This field shows the lists, programs or experiments that exist and can be exported
Files being exported This list indicates which files exist and will be exported
Export Save all the lists, programs or experiments into a zip file, that can be imported from any computer

data.name: importInstructions
data.value:
General
Option Description
File Selects the zip file with lists, programs or experiments that will be imported
Import all files Check this box if you want all programs in file to be imported
Existing files This field shows the lists, programs or experiments that exist in the zip file and can be imported
Files being imported This list indicates which files will be imported
Import Save all the lists, programs or experiments from a zip file into the lists, programs or experiments directory, being possible to use them.

data.name: MatchConfigInstructions
data.value:
General
Options Description
Program name Should be the name of the program that will be created. Program names should only have alphanumeric characters and have no spaces. This name will be the same name that must be selected when selecting a program to be executed and in the export/import
Exposition
Options Description
Exposition type The matching test working this way: will be exposed a model and some stimulus for the participant choose, The model will aways appears as stimulu.
The way that the participant will react to the stimulus will depends of exposition type, that are:
  • DMTS: The participant must choose the stimulus that is equal to the model shown.
  • DNMTS: The participant must NOT choose the estimate that is equal to the model shown.
  • DMTS/DNMTS: The participant will be exposed, alternately, to DMTS and DNMTS, making the appropriate choice for the type of exhibition that will be displayed.
Stimulu type Stimulus Type sets the type of stimulus to be displayed, the alternatives being:
  • Image: It should be chosen a list of images that will be shown as stimulus
  • Word: A list of words and a fixed color must be chosen for them to be displayed
  • Word and Color: Two lists should be chosen, one being a word and one color, so that each word appears with a color from the list
Comments:
  • The number of elements in the list of words or images must always be greater than the number of stimuli.
  • The number of elements in the list should preferably be greater than the total number of stimuli that will be shown.
Stimulus number Defines how many stimuli will appear after the model so that the participant chooses one of them.
Attempts number Sets the number of retries the user will have.
Exposition size Defines the size of the stimulus and its meaning varies for each type of main stimulus:
  • For image list: The size of the stimulus defines, in pixels, the size of the square that the image will be displayed.
  • For list of words: The size of the stimulus defines, in pixels, the font size that the word will be rendered.
Random position Sets whether to use preset positions or random positions.
  • Stimuli: The stimuli will appear in random positions, but they will never overlap.
  • Model: The model will appear in a random position.
Random order Defines whether the order of appearance of exposures will follow the order in the list or whether they will be reordered at the beginning of each program run.
Finish model exposition with click Sets whether the model will disappear if the participant clicks it.
Lists
Options Description
Words Defines the list of words that will be used in the exposition of words or words and colors.
Colors Sets the color list that will be used in the exposition of words and colors.
Images Sets the list of images that will be used in the image exposition.
Audios There is still no use for this type of list in the test of choice.
Time
Options Description
Model exposition(ms) Sets, in ms, the time the model will be exposed.
Stimulu exposition(ms) Sets, in ms, the time the stimuli will be exposed.
Delay between model and stimulus(ms) Sets, in ms, the interval time between the model and the stimuli.
Delay between attempts(ms) Sets, in ms, the interval time between the stimuli and the model of the next exposure.
Atraso entre modelo e estimulo variável Sets whether the interval between attempts is random.
  • If this option is checked, the delay will be random, but never greater than the delay between attempts.
  • The delay between attempts should be greater than or equal to 400ms.
Variable delay between model and stimuli Sets whether the interval between the model and the stimuli is random.
  • If this option is checked, the delay will be random, but never greater than the delay between the model and the stimuli.
  • The delay between model and stimuli should be greater than or equal to 400ms.
Colors
Options Description
DMTS Background Defines DMTS expostion background
  • If the type of exposure is DMTS / DNMTS what will indicate the current exposure type is the background color.
    		•
    DNMTS Background Defines DNMTS expostion background
  • If the type of exposure is DMTS / DNMTS what will indicate the current exposure type is the background color.
    		•
    Words Words In the 'words' expostion type, this will be the color in which all the words in the list will be rendered.
    Auditory signaling
    Options Description
    Exposition Sets if will be an auditory signaling when an exposition is shown
    Match / Error Sets if will be an auditory signaling when the participant match of do not match the chosen stimulu with the model.
    Commission Sets if will be an error auditory signaling when user click on model with the option 'End model exposition with click' disabled.
    Omission Sets if will be an error auditory signaling when the participant do not click on model or the stimulu in time.
    Instructions
    Defines the text that will be displyed at start of the program, each line in this text will be rendered in a blank screen at exposition.

data.name: matchingResultsInstructions
data.value:
General
Option Description
Export as .cvs It exports the results to a file with values separated by comma, which can be opened by spreadsheet editors programs (ex: libre office).
Results
Option Description
ProgramThe program name
ParticipantThe participant name
DateDate that the program was executed
Initial TimeTime when the program was executed
Exposition TimeTime when the exposition was rendered
Model Reaction TimeTime that participant take to answer to the model
Stimulu Reaction Time(ms)Time that participant take to answer to the stimulu
Interval between attempts(ms)Time elapsed since last attempt
Interval(ms)Interval between the model and the stimulus exposition
Model Exposition(ms)Time that model stayed in screen
Stimulu Exposition(ms)Time that stimulu stayed in screen
SenquencyCronological order that stimulus appered to participant
Test TypeTest type of exposition
Stimulus TypeStimulu type of exposition
List Lists that was used in program
Model first positionWhere the model appeared
Model Name of the model
Model colorColor of the model
2nd StimuluName of 2nd stimulu
3rd Stimulu Name of 3rd stimulu
4th Stimulu Name of 4th stimulu
5th Stumulu Name of 5th stimulu
6th Stimulu Name of 6th stimulu
7th Stimulu Name of 7th stimulu
8th Stimulu Name of 8th stimulu
Model second positionWhere the model appeared as stimulu
Clicked StimuluName of the stimulu that participant clicked
Clicked Stimulu ColorColor of the stimulu that participant clicked
Clicked Stimulu PositionPosition of the stimulu that participant clicked
MatchUser clicked the stimulu equals the model
